page.title: 10INDUSTRY IN GRANTHAM
page.content: Since 1945 Grantham has sited several of its new areas of industry out of its centre, eg the Alma Park complex on hilly land not accessible to the main road, the A1 or to the railway, both of which are to the W of the town. However the land selected for the Alma Park Estate had already been used in World Wars 1 & 2 by the military services & some of the farm- land was not profitable enough to remain as countryside. Most of the new sites are occupied by comparatively light industries & 1 or 2 are strictly service industries headquarters and stores. The East Midlands Electricity Board complex being a good example. Others like the Stanbrough Press, Grosvenor Furniture,Kontak Engineering and Paktronic are new & expanding sites engaged in modern manufactures and sales. It strains local services.
